summary: This document contains email correspondence from August 14, 2019, between an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York and a staff member from the Education Department at FCC Forrest City. The MCC Associate Warden discusses dealing with false information being spread about them, suggests it may be to divert attention from their boss, and mentions efforts to keep staff uplifted during a difficult time.

persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York
persons.context: The sender of an email discussing false information being spread about them, possibly to divert attention from their boss, and efforts to keep staff morale up.

persons.context: The recipient who initiated contact, expressing admiration for the Associate Warden, offering prayers and assistance, and quoting biblical verses about not spreading gossip or false testimony.

connections.person1: Education Department FCC Forrest City Staff
connections.description: Former colleagues from when the Associate Warden was at Yazoo; the FCC staff member has admired and kept up with the Associate Warden's career.
The Associate Warden suggests false information about them may be spread to take heat off their boss.

keyFacts: An Associate Warden at MCC New York claims false and non-factual information is being spread about them, possibly to divert attention ('take the heat off') from their boss.
The Associate Warden indicates they are nearing retirement but plan to leave on their own terms.
The correspondence occurs on August 14, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in MCC New York custody on August 10, 2019, suggesting the 'difficult time' may be related.
Biblical verses (Exodus 23:1-2) are quoted advising against malicious gossip and falsifying testimony, which may be a pointed reference to the surrounding circumstances.
The Associate Warden is focused on keeping staff uplifted during this period.
